item.title: Mechanical Draughtsperson
item.description:
Production Mechanical Draughtsperson (Waterford)

∑   Site based project.
∑   Client facing
∑   6 months minimum  

The role requires the following experience:

∑   Mechanical qualification for metal fabrication production / commissioning / installation
∑   4+ years experience in production drawing
∑   Plant layout experience
∑   Proficiency of AutoCAD or Solidworks.
∑   Salary Negotiable D.O.E.

For a confidential discussion about this position and other similar opportunities please either call Eoin Carey on 00353 56 7786631 or email your CV through the link provided.

All applications treated in strictest confidence.

Immediate start

eoin@optimizerecruitment.ie

item.title: Account Executive - Email Mar
item.description:
Account Executive  - Email Marketing
Reporting to the Client Services Director and Email Marketing Manager

Overall job summary
To assist members of the email marketing and client services team with the management and efficient running of email marketing projects, and ensure all administration is up to date and stored with our Traffic management system

Key Responsibilities Operational
To contribute essential administrative and practical support to the Client Services team, Email Marketing, Directors, Creative and Production team, as required

To assist all members of the ReportMail team with all aspects of projects, from liaising and taking amends, to maintaining efficient and well organised digital files within the traffic system (our project management system)

To proactively assist in the collation of all information necessary to the smooth progression of a project, ensuring it is promptly actioned and  forwarded to the relevant parties

To contribute to the collation of ReportMail reports for existing or new clients

To contribute to the collation and creation of tenders and proposals for existing or new clients

To liaise regularly with the Creative Team, to ensure they have all the up-to-date facts/information necessary, to efficiently plan and accurately prioritise


Traffic
To ensure all client contacts and project information has been correctly entered into the Traffic system

To use Traffic to efficiently maintain extensive well organised digital files, capturing and managing all financial aspects of the account from the creation of budgets, to active cost capture, ensuring that all invoicing is correctly issued at the appropriate time, with overdue receivables being chased accordingly. Ensuring there is a full audit trail for all projects

To ensure accurate, daily records of all chargeable time and client contact information by yourself is maintained within the Traffic project management system

New Business
To be actively aware of any new business opportunities and share with the team

Corporate
To be an effective team player in helping management deliver on the business plan

item.title: Mechanical Draughtsperson
item.description:
Mechanical Draughtsperson - England

Immediate Start

Due to continued success, my client involved in the Design, Manufacture, Installation and Commissioning of Mechanical Plant and Equipment has immediate requirements for experience Mechanical Draughtsperson for a 3 month contract based in the UK (Manchester / Bristol region).

Home every weekend.
Flights, accommodation, transportation paid.

Project: Manufacturing / Processing facility

This operation works with their clients from initial concept through planning, feasibility studies, system design, manufacture and commissioning.     

The successful individual will have the following:
∑   Minimum of 5+ years experience (essential)
∑   Relevant qualification
∑   AutoCAD Proficient (essential)
∑   Plant and equipment industry experience
∑   Mechanical Design & Plant Layout experience
∑   Site Surveying and estimates

Solidworks experience an advantage but not essential

Salary negotiable - excellent rate available!!

Full drivers license essential

This is an excellent opportunity to join a progressive, dynamic company with exciting career development prospects. Remuneration package shall reflect  experience.

For additional information and a confidential discussion on these roles contact Eoin on: 056 7886631 or e-mail your details in strictest confidence to: eoin@optimizerecruitment.ie

item.title: Childcare Assessor
item.description:
Job Title:
Childcare Assessor

Location:
Cheshire

Type:
Temporary To Permanent

Salary: 7.50p/h


My Nantwich based client is looking for a Childcare Assessor to work 18 hours per week in the Cheshire Area.

Applicants must hold A1 (Assessor Award) be competent within the childcare sector and have a minimum of 4 years experience.
As an assessor you would:
∑   Plan and deliver the training programmes and workshops on a regular basis with candidate building up a rapport.
∑   Observe and assess candidates in their workplace
∑   Examine candidates` portfolios of evidence
∑   Look at all different methods of assessing criteria
∑   Question candidates about how they would deal with non-standard situations
∑   Provide feedback and offer advice if the standards are not met
∑   Carry out regular monthly progress reviews
∑   Discuss candidates progress with their line manager
∑   Report any issues to your line manager
∑   Sign off the NVQ when all the requirements have been met
∑   Keep records of candidates` progress, according to the requirements of the NVQ awarding bodies
∑   Attend meetings with other assessors
∑   Work closely with training staff and candidates` line managers.
∑   Advise line manager of any companies you visit of extra training requirements
∑   Assist line manager with updating necessary projects to stay current and in line with framework.
∑   Attend any workshops/training linked with relevant area of work.

Own Transport is essential as you will be assessing students anywhere within the Cheshire Area.

7.50p/h

This vacancy is being advertised by Barony Recruitment who are an employment agency.

item.title: Email Production Executive
item.description:
Email Production Executive role

This is a hands-on production role, supporting our email marketing service, reporting into our Email Marketing Services Manager. The position will involve using an email marketing system (ReportMailô) to manage email campaigns on behalf of our clients and also support our clients who use the system themselves.

Salary: £16k - £18k depending on experience

The role will involve:
  • Planning email campaigns with our account handlers
    • Using ReportMail to manage clients` email marketing campaigns
∑   Edit HTML templates
∑   Manage and upload data
∑   Set-up, test and send email campaigns
∑   Compile activity reports
  • Supporting clients using our email marketing system (handling phone and email queries)
  • Creating reports and gathering data to support consultancy work
  • Working with web designers on new email templates or HTML issues
  • Researching and implementing email best practice
  • Researching advancements in email marketing technology and strategy
  • Competitor research
  • Website maintenance
  • Writing blog articles


Key requirements are:
  • A good attention to detail
  • A passion for online marketing
  • An enthusiastic, proactive, can-do attitude
  • A personable, friendly manner
  • Be able to work well under pressure to tight deadlines
  • Working knowledge of html and Dreamweaver, but not essential as training will be provided

item.title: TELESALES
item.description:
Job Title:
TELESALES

Location:
Wardle, Near Nantwich

Type:
Permanent

Salary:
£14-16k

Our client is looking for an experienced telesales person to promote a range of fuel cards to prospective customers in both new and existing markets. To drive the profitability of existing customers portfolios and provide sales and card administration support to depot teams and the card marketing manager.
Main Duties:
- To Achieve new business volume related targets by prospecting, identifying and selling to new and existing customers.
- Active cold calling to continuously develop and identify no prospects.
- To report sales calls, applications received and accounts opened on a weekly (informal) and monthly (formal) basis.
- To assist and offer customers and depots guidance and support with queries and follow through to a successful conclusion.
- As a team ensure that weekly invoicing is completed timely and accurately.
- To assist the credit control team with any issues relating directly to your accounts.
- Maintain accurate and up to date records on all accounts and prospects, ensuring prospect and customer files are well maintained and accurate.

The ideal candidate will have a sales background , good negotiation and communication skills, computer literate and have own transport due to location.

This is a full time role Mon-Fri and our client is a large company who offer progression through the business.

item.title: Sales Executive
item.description:
Sales Execs required to sell insurance policies to a range of clients supplied by 3rd party business partners, by either outbound dialling or inbound calling.

Responsibilities:
- Deliver agreed sales targets by inbound/outbound calling to convert customer leads.
- Use a professional manner towards customers to provide excellent customer service.
- Work to the agreed sales system and perform all duties in line with stated regulatory requirements and standards.
- Cross selling of other products and services where appropriate.
- Promote the group and it`s business partners in a professional manner to customers and colleagues.
- Complete ad hoc projects as required by the business.
- Achieve agreed targets regarding the dialler.

Experience:
- Professional attitude
- Sales focused
- Proven ability to work to targets
- Self motivated
- Ability to interact well within a team environment

Salary £15k OTE £18 - £25K
Hours 42.5 per week on a shift rota. Mon - Fri 8.30am - 8pm and 9am - 6pm Sat.

This vacancy is being advertised by Barony Recruitment who are an employment agency.
